Class jsonComplexElement

java.lang.Object
jsonElement
jsonComplexElement
Direct Known Subclasses:
jsonArray, jsonObject
public class jsonComplexElement extends jsonElement
jsonComplexElement is used to hold information for the two different complex elements: array and object To hold necessary hierarchical information, each jsonComplexElement has a list children of each type

  • Field Details

    • fieldNo

      protected int fieldNo

    • children

  • Constructor Details

    • jsonComplexElement

      public jsonComplexElement(String name, int fieldNo, int depth)
      Constructor for named complex elements
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the element
      fieldNo - The number of children fields belonging to the complex element. If the complex element is an object, the number of child fields, or if it is an array, the number of entries.
      depth - The depth of the complex element within the abstract syntax tree.

    • jsonComplexElement

      public jsonComplexElement(int fieldNo, int depth)
      Constructor for anonymous complex elements
      Parameters:
      fieldNo - The number of children fields belonging to the complex element. If the complex element is an object, the number of child fields, or if it is an array, the number of entries.
      depth - The depth of the complex element within the abstract syntax tree.

  • Method Details

    • getChildObjs

      public ArrayList<jsonObject> getChildObjs()
      Getter for the childObjs arraylist.
      Returns:
      The list of all children of the complex element that are objects.

    • getDepth

      public int getDepth()
      Getter for the depth of the complex object.
      Returns:
      The depth of the complex element.

    • setDepth

      public void setDepth(int depth)
      Setter for the depth of the complex element
      Parameters:
      depth - The depth to set

    • getFieldNo

      public int getFieldNo()
      Getter for the field number of the complex element.
      Returns:
      The field number will be returned. If the complex element is a jsonObject, the number of fields contained in the object will be returned. If the complex element is a jsonArray, the number of items in the array will be returned.

    • getChildArrs

      public ArrayList<jsonArray> getChildArrs()
      Getter for the childArrs arraylist.
      Returns:
      The list of all children of the complex element that are arrays.

    • addChildObj

      public void addChildObj(jsonObject childObj)
      Method to add a child object to the list of children objects of the complex element.
      Parameters:
      childObj - The child object to be added to the list of child objects.

    • addChildArr

      public void addChildArr(jsonArray childArr)
      Method to add a child array to the list of children arrays of the complex element.
      Parameters:
      childArr - The child array to be added to the list of child arrays.

    • addChildElement

      public void addChildElement(jsonElement child)
      Method to add a simple child element (i.e. int, string, null, boolean values) to the list of child elements belonging to the complex element.
      Parameters:
      child - The child element to be added to the list of children

    • elementDescription

      public String elementDescription(descriptionLevel l, descriptionLevel n)
      This method creates a description for each complex element depending on which command line options have been specified by the user
      Parameters:
      l - : The description level required. Will either be toplevel, complex elements, or full. This parameter is dependent upon the input options specified by the user on the command line
      n - : If the nesting option is enabled by the user at the command line interface, parameter n will be set to n so that the nesting depth of each element will be explicitly specified before it is described
      Returns:
      A description of the complex element

    • elemDescription

      protected String elemDescription()
      For each complex element a description is created with the following information (1) Whether the element is named or anonymous (2) The type of the complex element (array or object) (3) How many fields belong to the complex element
      Overrides:
      elemDescription in class jsonElement
      Returns:
      A description of the basic properties of the complex element

    • listAllChildren

      protected String listAllChildren()
      Generates a description string based on the child elements of the complex element. listAllChildren() iterates through the children data structure and lists all of the children the complex element has, categorised by type. Child objects are passed to the groupSimilarObjects so that information about objects with identical structure can be added to the description.
      Returns:
      A description of all of the children belonging to the complex element

    • listAllChildrenAndValues

      protected String listAllChildrenAndValues()
      Similar to the listAllChildren() method. fullListAllChildren() lists the child elements of the complex element and their values.
      Returns:
      A list of all of the children of the complex element and their corresponding values.

    • listFields

      protected String listFields(int numOfType, String type)
      Helper method for the listAllChildren and listAllChildrenAndValues methods
      Parameters:
      numOfType - Number of elements of the specified type.
      type - The type of the elements. E.g. "integer", "string" etc.
      Returns:
      A string description in the form: " fields are/is a value(s)"
